1.text: Do not envy wicked men or desire their company;

2.text: for their hearts devise violence, and their lips declare trouble.

3.text: By wisdom a house is built and by understanding it is established;

4.text: through knowledge its rooms are filled with every precious and beautiful treasure.

5.text: A wise man is strong, and a man of knowledge enhances his strength.

6.text: Only with sound guidance should you wage war, and victory lies in a multitude of counselors.

7.text: Wisdom is too high for a fool; he does not open his mouth in the meeting place.

8.text: He who plots evil will be called a schemer.

9.text: A foolish scheme is sin, and a mocker is detestable to men.

10.text: If you faint in the day of distress, how small is your strength!

11.text: Rescue those being led away to death, and restrain those stumbling toward the slaughter.

12.text: If you say, “Behold, we did not know about this,” does not He who weighs hearts consider it? Does not the One who guards your life know? Will He not repay a man according to his deeds?

13.text: Eat honey, my son, for it is good, and the honeycomb is sweet to your taste.

14.text: Know therefore that wisdom is sweet to your soul. If you find it, there is a future for you, and your hope will never be cut off.

15.text: Do not lie in wait, O wicked man, near the dwelling of the righteous; do not destroy his resting place.

16.text: For though a righteous man may fall seven times, he still gets up; but the wicked stumble in bad times.

17.text: Do not gloat when your enemy falls, and do not let your heart rejoice when he stumbles,

18.text: or the LORD will see and disapprove, and turn His wrath away from him.

19.text: Do not fret over evildoers, and do not be envious of the wicked.

20.text: For the evil man has no future; the lamp of the wicked will be extinguished.

21.text: My son, fear the LORD and the king, and do not associate with the rebellious.

22.text: For they will bring sudden destruction. Who knows what ruin they can bring?

23.text: These also are sayings of the wise: To show partiality in judgment is not good.

24.text: Whoever tells the guilty, “You are innocent”—peoples will curse him, and nations will denounce him;

25.text: but it will go well with those who convict the guilty, and rich blessing will come upon them.

26.text: An honest answer given is like a kiss on the lips.

27.text: Complete your outdoor work and prepare your field; after that, you may build your house.

28.text: Do not testify against your neighbor without cause, and do not deceive with your lips.

29.text: Do not say, “I will do to him as he has done to me; I will repay the man according to his work.”

30.text: I went past the field of a slacker and by the vineyard of a man lacking judgment.

31.text: Thorns had grown up everywhere, thistles had covered the ground, and the stone wall was broken down.

32.text: I observed and took it to heart; I looked and received instruction:

33.text: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest,

34.text: and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and need like a bandit.
